prompt: Facts: The appellant, Vijayan, was married to Jayshree in May 1999.; Allegations arose that prior to and after the marriage, the appellant and his family demanded dowry including Rs. 50,000, furniture, and utensils.; Jayshree died by hanging in her matrimonial home on October 19, 2000 (within 7 years of marriage).; The deceased's father (PW1) and mother (PW2) testified about the dowry demands and the physical and mental torture inflicted upon Jayshree by the appellant.; A letter (Ext. P1), written by the deceased Jayshree to her father shortly before her death, detailed the harassment and torture she faced from the appellant.; The prosecution initiated proceedings based on the complaint filed by the deceased's father.; Post-mortem report indicated the cause of death as asphyxia due to hanging.; The Trial Court convicted the appellant under Section 498A (Cruelty) and Section 306 (Abetment of Suicide) of the IPC.; The High Court of Kerala upheld the conviction and sentence passed by the Trial Court.; The appellant (Vijayan) filed the present appeal before the Supreme Court challenging the High Court's judgment. | IPC: Section 306 (Abetment of Suicide), Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), Section 107 (Abetment of a thing - discussed in context of S. 306), Section 304B (Dowry Death - discussed contextually but not the primary charge/conviction)
